channel.title: Guide on Ctrl+Alt+Dark
channel.description: Recent content in Guide on Ctrl+Alt+Dark

item.title: Speed vs Depth: The Art of Investigation Theory in the Real World
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Learn to balance speed and thoroughness in MDR investigations using Kill Chain analysis and Likelihood vs Impact matrices to make fast, defensible decisions under pressure.

item.title: Learning in the AI Era - Part 3: Practical Workflow with NotebookLM
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: A hands-on guide to using NotebookLM for cybersecurity learning, including how to create study guides, generate flashcards, and build audio podcasts from technical documentation for active learning.

item.title: Using NetTriage for IP & Domain Triage
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Automate IP and domain investigations with NetTriage, a Python tool that performs reputation lookups, DNS resolution, WHOIS checks, and passive DNS analysis for rapid threat triage.

item.title: Getting Started in Cyber Security
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: A comprehensive Australian guide to breaking into cybersecurity, covering red vs blue team paths, practical skills development, certifications, programming projects, and government career opportunities.

item.title: My Rack Setup - 2020 Extrusion DIY mini-rack
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Build your own compact 10-inch server rack using 2020 aluminium extrusion with detailed parts list, cut measurements, and assembly instructions for a modular homelab setup.
